{% extends "layout.html" %} {% block title %} Slacklining {% endblock %} {% block content %} {% filter markdown %} ## Your new hobby is: # Slacklining Slacklining refers to the act of walking, running or balancing along a suspended length of flat webbing that is tensioned between two anchors. Slacklining is similar to slack rope walking and tightrope walking. Slacklines differ from tightwires and tightropes in the type of material used and the amount of tension applied during use. Slacklines are tensioned significantly less than tightropes or tightwires in order to create a dynamic line which will stretch and bounce like a long and narrow trampoline. Tension can be adjusted to suit the user, and different webbing may be used in various circumstances. Find out more on [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slacklining)! {% endfilter %} {% endblock %}
